'''iOS 17''' is the [[iOS version history|seventeenth and current major release]] of [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s [[iOS]] operating system for the [[iPhone]]. It is the direct successor to [[iOS 16]], which was released one year earlier. It was announced on June 5, 2023, at Apple's annual [[Worldwide Developers Conference]] alongside [[watchOS#watchOS 10|watchOS 10]], [[iPadOS 17]], and [[macOS Sonoma]]. It was made publicly available on September 18, 2023, as a free software update for supported iOS devices (see the [[#Supported devices|supported devices]] section).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/09/18/apple-releases-ios-17/|title=Apple Releases iOS 17 With StandBy, Live Voicemail, Improved Autocorrect, FaceTime Video Messages and Tons More|website=[[MacRumors]]|first=Juli|last=Clover|date=September 18, 2023|access-date=September 18, 2023|archive-date=September 18, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230918172753/https://www.macrumors.com/2023/09/18/apple-releases-ios-17/|url-status=live}}</ref> iOS 17 has received security and bug-fix updates multiple times a month, and feature updates every few months. Beta builds are sent weekly or biweekly to members of the [[Apple Developer Program]] and [[public beta]] testers. As with every release since [[iOS 4]], these updates are free to users.

== Early development ==
iOS 17's internal codename is Dawn.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Gurman |first=Mark |date=January 8, 2023 |title=Apple Will Talk Up Its Mixed-Reality Headset in 2023 But Not Much Else |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-01-08/when-will-apple-launch-the-reality-pro-mixed-reality-headset-apple-2023-devices-lcnfzkc7 |access-date=May 31, 2023 |work=Bloomberg News |language=en |archive-date=May 5, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230505132018/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/newsletters/2023-01-08/when-will-apple-launch-the-reality-pro-mixed-reality-headset-apple-2023-devices-lcnfzkc7 |url-status=live }}</ref> Apple initially intended iOS 17 as a "tuneup release", similar to [[iOS 12]] and [[Mac OS X Snow Leopard]], allowing them to focus on their new [[Apple Vision Pro]] mixed reality headset. Still, they added major features later in the development cycle.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Malik |first=Aisha |date=March 27, 2023 |title=Apple's iOS 17 may include 'several' requested features |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/03/27/apples-ios-17-may-include-several-requested-features/ |access-date=May 31, 2023 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US |archive-date=March 27, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327160343/https://techcrunch.com/2023/03/27/apples-ios-17-may-include-several-requested-features/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Gurman |first=Mark |date=May 24, 2023 |title=Apple Plans to Turn Locked iPhones Into Smart Displays With iOS 17 |language=en |work=Bloomberg News |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-05-24/apple-aapl-plans-to-turn-locked-iphones-into-smart-displays-with-ios-17 |access-date=May 31, 2023 |archive-date=June 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230602031451/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-05-24/apple-aapl-plans-to-turn-locked-iphones-into-smart-displays-with-ios-17 |url-status=live }}</ref>

== System features ==

=== Home Screen ===
* Home and Lock screens widgets are now interactive. For example, a user can turn on lights or open shutters of a house by pressing the corresponding button of the Home widget, mark a task complete by pressing directly on a reminder in the widget, etc.<ref name="TheVergeannounces2">{{Cite web |last=Johnson |first=Allison |date=June 5, 2023 |title=Apple announces iOS 17 with StandBy charging mode and better autocorrect |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/5/23738813/apple-ios-17-features-specs-updates-wwdc-2023 |access-date=June 8, 2023 |website=The Verge |archive-date=June 8, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230608004946/https://www.theverge.com/2023/6/5/23738813/apple-ios-17-features-specs-updates-wwdc-2023 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple iOS 17 Rolls out Tomorrow with Multiple Advanced Features |url=https://www.india.com/technology/apple-ios-17-rolls-out-tomorrow-multiple-advanced-features-iphone-shareplay-siri-wonderlust-6331685/ |access-date=January 22, 2024 |website=india.com |language=en |archive-date=January 22, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240122223739/https://www.india.com/technology/apple-ios-17-rolls-out-tomorrow-multiple-advanced-features-iphone-shareplay-siri-wonderlust-6331685/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
* [[Spotlight (Apple)|Spotlight search]] now allows users to change system settings directly from the search results. For example, if a user searches for "wifi" from the Home Screen, the switch to turn the Wi-Fi off or on appears in the search results.
* Other changes:
** The brightness of the wallpaper image changes depending on the dark or light mode.<ref>{{Cite web |title=How to enable Dark Mode in iOS 17 on your iPhone or iPad {{!}} My Computer My Way |url=http://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/how-to-enable-dark-mode-in-ios-17-on-your-iphone-or-ipad |access-date=January 9, 2024 |website=mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk |language=en |archive-date=January 9, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240109230222/http://mcmw.abilitynet.org.uk/how-to-enable-dark-mode-in-ios-17-on-your-iphone-or-ipad |url-status=live }}</ref>
** Resized photos are automatically extended to the top with a gradient that fills the missing space.<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 20, 2023 |title=A weird wallpaper change in iOS 17 |url=https://ljpuk.net/2023/08/20/a-weird-wallpaper-change-in-ios-17/ |access-date=January 9, 2024 |website=LJPUK |language=en |archive-date=January 9, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240109230216/https://ljpuk.net/2023/08/20/a-weird-wallpaper-change-in-ios-17/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
** Live wallpapers return after being removed from iOS 16, though they must now be selected separately from other photos and only animate when the phone is turned on.<ref>{{Cite web|title=iOS 17 brings back Live Photos as wallpapers on the Lock Screen|url=https://superchargednews.com/2023/06/07/ios-17-live-photos-as-wallpapers/|access-date=November 17, 2023|website=Supercharged news|date=June 7, 2023 |language=en|archive-date=November 17, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231117221219/https://superchargednews.com/2023/06/07/ios-17-live-photos-as-wallpapers/|url-status=live}}</ref>

=== StandBy ===
* StandBy mode is a new feature automatically enabled when the phone is charging while horizontally oriented. It displays information via widgets in intelligent stacks, Live activities, and the clock. The appearance of this information changes according to the ambient light, with less flashy and less bright colors appearing at night.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 17: Exciting New Features iPhone Users Should Prepare For |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-exciting-new-features-iphone-users-should-prepare-for/ |access-date=September 19, 2023 |publisher=CNET |language=en |archive-date=September 20, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230920135933/https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-exciting-new-features-iphone-users-should-prepare-for/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Autocorrect and text prediction ===
* The keyboard's autocorrection and dictation are powered by a new on-device [[transformer model]], which is advertised to be more accurate and personalized to users' writing styles.<ref name="why-a-duck">{{Cite news|last=Hassan |first=Jennifer |date=June 6, 2023 |title=Apple says new iPhone autocorrect will know you don't mean 'duck' |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/06/06/apple-duck-autocorrect-update-ios17/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |newspaper=The Washington Post}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Vigliarolo |first=Brandon |title=Apple fixes 'ducking' autocorrect in iOS 17 |url=https://www.theregister.com/2023/06/07/duck_off_apple_autocorrect/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=The Register |language=en |archive-date=June 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230617170325/https://www.theregister.com/2023/06/07/duck_off_apple_autocorrect/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
* Unlike previous versions of iOS, it can learn not to autocorrect [[swear words]].<ref name="why-a-duck" /><ref>{{Cite web |last=Vigliarolo |first=Brandon |title=Apple fixes 'ducking' autocorrect in iOS 17 |url=https://www.theregister.com/2023/06/07/duck_off_apple_autocorrect/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=The Register |language=en |archive-date=June 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230617170325/https://www.theregister.com/2023/06/07/duck_off_apple_autocorrect/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
* Autocorrected words are underlined and can be reverted with a tap.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Too Many Autocorrect Fails? Tweak These Keyboard Settings on Your iPhone and iPad |url=https://www.pcmag.com/how-to/autocorrect-fails-tweak-iphone-pad-keyboard-settings |access-date=February 10, 2024 |website=PC Magazine |language=en |archive-date=February 13, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240213083728/https://www.pcmag.com/how-to/autocorrect-fails-tweak-iphone-pad-keyboard-settings |url-status=live }}</ref>
* Word predictions are shown inline as grey letters that are added when the spacebar is tapped.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Rossignol |first=Joe |date=June 5, 2023 |title=iOS 17 Promises to Dramatically Improve iPhone's Autocorrect |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/05/ios-17-improved-autocorrect/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en |archive-date=June 16, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230616094135/https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/05/ios-17-improved-autocorrect/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Rossignol |first=Joe |date=June 5, 2023 |title=iOS 17 Promises to Dramatically Improve iPhone's Autocorrect |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/05/ios-17-improved-autocorrect/ |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en |archive-date=June 16, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230616094135/https://www.macrumors.com/2023/06/05/ios-17-improved-autocorrect/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Santos |first=Maria Cecília Romão |date=October 19, 2023 |title=iOS 17 Features List: What's New for Users and Developers? |url=https://cheesecakelabs.com/blog/ios-17-features-list/ |access-date=January 9, 2024 |website=Cheesecake Labs |language=en-US |archive-date=January 9, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240109201640/https://cheesecakelabs.com/blog/ios-17-features-list/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
* As of iOS 17.2, the option to turn off inline predictions without turning off predictive text was added, which allows the user to switch autocorrect to that of its functions in versions prior to [[iOS 8]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Espósito |first=Filipe |date=November 14, 2023 |title=iOS 17.2 lets users disable inline text predictions without turning off predictive text |url=https://9to5mac.com/2023/11/14/ios-17-2-disable-inline-text-predictions/#:~:text=With%20the%20third%20beta%20of,turn%20off%20inline%20text%20predictions. |access-date=November 17, 2023 |website=9to5Mac |language=en |archive-date=November 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231117163152/https://9to5mac.com/2023/11/14/ios-17-2-disable-inline-text-predictions/#:~:text=With%20the%20third%20beta%20of,turn%20off%20inline%20text%20predictions. |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Translation ===
* [[Ukrainian language]] was added for translation available system-wide, in Safari web pages, and in the [[Translate (Apple)|Translate app]], bringing the number of languages available to 20.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple translator receives important update for Ukrainians |url=https://newsukraine.rbc.ua/news/apple-translator-receives-important-update-1695753716.html |access-date=January 8, 2024 |website=RBC-Ukraine |language=en |archive-date=December 8, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231208020720/https://newsukraine.rbc.ua/news/apple-translator-receives-important-update-1695753716.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS and iPadOS - Feature Availability |url=https://www.apple.com/ios/feature-availability/ |access-date=January 8, 2024 |website=Apple |language=en-US |archive-date=January 5, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220105160123/https://www.apple.com/ios/feature-availability/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== AirDrop ===
* With the addition of NameDrop, by tapping an iPhone or Apple Watch against another iPhone, users can start a file transfer, a shared activity with SharePlay, or exchange a customizable contact card.<ref>{{Cite web |first1=Sarah |last1=Perez |first2=Aisha |last2=Malik |date=June 5, 2023 |title=AirDrop in iOS 17 will let you share contact info by bringing two iPhones close together |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/06/05/airdrop-in-ios-17-will-let-you-share-contact-info-by-bringing-two-iphones-close-together |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=[[TechCrunch]] |archive-date=June 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230617114737/https://techcrunch.com/2023/06/05/airdrop-in-ios-17-will-let-you-share-contact-info-by-bringing-two-iphones-close-together/ |url-status=live }}</ref> (Using NameDrop with an Apple Watch requires iOS 17.1 and [[WatchOS 10|watchOS 10.1]].)
* As of iOS 17.1, [[AirDrop]] file transfers can continue over the Internet if users leave AirDrop range.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-1-features/|title=iOS 17.1 Features: What's New in iOS 17.1|first=Juli|last=Clover|date=October 25, 2023|website=[[MacRumors]]|access-date=November 20, 2023|archive-date=November 20, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231120060353/https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-1-features/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Malik |first=Sarah Perez and Aisha |date=June 5, 2023 |title=AirDrop in iOS 17 will let you share contact info by bringing two iPhones close together |url=https://techcrunch.com/2023/06/05/airdrop-in-ios-17-will-let-you-share-contact-info-by-bringing-two-iphones-close-together |access-date=June 17, 2023 |website=TechCrunch |archive-date=June 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230617114737/https://techcrunch.com/2023/06/05/airdrop-in-ios-17-will-let-you-share-contact-info-by-bringing-two-iphones-close-together/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Siri ===
* Users can now simply address Siri by its name instead of having to say "Hey Siri" to activate it.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |date=September 15, 2023 |title=iOS 17: Everything New With Siri and Spotlight |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-siri-spotlight/ |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en |archive-date=December 7, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231207180439/https://www.macrumors.com/guide/ios-17-siri-spotlight/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="TheVergeannounces2"/>
* Subsequent questions asked to Siri do not require the user to re-say the "Siri" command.<ref name=":1" />
* The user can now say "Hey Siri, send a message" and then choose the application to use through a drop-down menu.<ref name=":1" /> After the first change, Siri will remember the choice and speed up the operation.<ref name=":1" />
* Users can ask Siri to read a page in [[Safari (web browser)|Safari]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Use Siri to listen to a webpage in Safari on iPhone |url=https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/use-siri-to-listen-to-a-webpage-iph449fc616c/ios |access-date=January 21, 2024 |website=Apple Support |language=en |archive-date=December 14, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231214040601/https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/use-siri-to-listen-to-a-webpage-iph449fc616c/ios |url-status=live }}</ref>
* Additionally, the ability to find a lost [[Siri Remote|Apple TV remote]] with it with was added.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Use your iPhone to help locate the Siri Remote (2nd generation or later) |url=https://support.apple.com/guide/tv/locate-siri-remote-2nd-generation-atvb9f872f61/tvos |access-date=January 21, 2024 |website=Apple Support |language=en |archive-date=October 17, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231017015142/https://support.apple.com/guide/tv/locate-siri-remote-2nd-generation-atvb9f872f61/tvos |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== AutoFill ===
* The information saved by the user in Contacts can be used to automatically and securely fill in the fields of a form of a PDF or scanned document. Scanning documents take place in Notes.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Dsouza |first=Darryl |date=June 12, 2023 |title=How to Use Enhanced AutoFill and Collaborate on PDF Files on iPhone, iPad and Mac |url=https://www.macobserver.com/tips/how-to/use-enhanced-autofill-and-collaborate-on-pdf-files-on-iphone-ipad-and-mac/ |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=The Mac Observer |language=en-US |archive-date=December 7, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231207180709/https://www.macobserver.com/tips/how-to/use-enhanced-autofill-and-collaborate-on-pdf-files-on-iphone-ipad-and-mac/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Accessibility ===
* A new feature called ''Personal Voice'' uses machine learning to let users recreate their own voice as a text-to-speech model.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Velazco |first=Chris |date=May 16, 2023 |title=Apple will let you teach your iPhone to speak in your voice |newspaper=The Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/05/16/apple-personal-voice-ai-iphone/ |access-date=June 17, 2023}}</ref>
* Using ''Point and speak'', the phone will read what is written on the push-button panels of household appliances.<ref>{{Citation |title=How to use Point and Speak on iPhone or iPad {{!}} Apple Support |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nJPt34n3aAM |access-date=February 12, 2024 |language=en |archive-date=February 12, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240212225130/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nJPt34n3aAM |url-status=live }}</ref>
*  A feature called ''Assistive Access'' is an extremely simplified iOS user interface that can be activated from the Accessibility settings, useful for people with cognitive disabilities.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Assistive Access User Guide |url=https://support.apple.com/guide/assistive-access-iphone/welcome/ios |access-date=February 12, 2024 |website=Apple Support |language=en |archive-date=February 12, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240212225130/https://support.apple.com/guide/assistive-access-iphone/welcome/ios |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Networking ===
* A user can now connect an iPhone to a private [[5G]] or [[LTE (telecommunication)|LTE]] cellular network, using an [[eSIM]] or physical SIM that has been specifically provisioned for that network.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple device support for private 5G and LTE networks |url=https://support.apple.com/guide/deployment/support-for-private-5g-and-lte-networks-depac6747317/web |access-date=August 12, 2023 |website=Apple Support |language=en |archive-date=August 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230812075051/https://support.apple.com/guide/deployment/support-for-private-5g-and-lte-networks-depac6747317/web |url-status=live }}</ref>
* There is also a new setting for cellular networks that allows users to disable cellular data usage statistics if they do not care which apps are consuming data.<ref>{{Cite web |date=January 21, 2024 |title=How to Check Data Usage on an iPhone or iPad |url=https://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/how-to-check-data-usage-on-an-iphone/ |access-date=February 10, 2024 |website=Digital Trends |language=en |archive-date=February 4, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240204173117/https://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/how-to-check-data-usage-on-an-iphone/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== System settings ===
* In addition to an updated UI that shows more categories, the iPhone Storage section of the settings app now shows the space occupied by data shared between multiple apps from the same manufacturer.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Manage your photo storage |url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/105061 |access-date=February 12, 2024 |website=Apple Support |language=en |archive-date=February 12, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240212225130/https://support.apple.com/en-us/105061 |url-status=live }}</ref>
* In the Haptic Touch duration settings, there is a third duration that is even shorter than the other two available in iOS 16.<ref>{{Cite web |date=August 30, 2023 |title=iOS 17: How to Make Haptic Touch Faster on iPhone |url=https://www.macrumors.com/how-to/make-haptic-touch-faster-on-iphone/ |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=MacRumors |language=en |archive-date=December 7, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231207182055/https://www.macrumors.com/how-to/make-haptic-touch-faster-on-iphone/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
* A new option for [[IOS 15#Focus|Focus]] mode notifications was added called ''Silence Notifications''. This option lets the user choose if they want to mute notifications always or only when the device is locked.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Song |first=Victoria |date=October 15, 2021 |title=How to use Focus modes in iOS 16 |url=https://www.theverge.com/23355242/ios-16-focus-modes-how-to-apple-iphone |access-date=January 9, 2024 |website=The Verge |language=en |archive-date=January 9, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240109201638/https://www.theverge.com/23355242/ios-16-focus-modes-how-to-apple-iphone |url-status=live }}</ref>
* In iOS 17, the notification sound was changed from "Tri-tone", to "Rebound", which is noticeably quieter. As of iOS 17.2, the ability to change the default sound effect for third party apps was added, including the previously default "Tri-tone" option.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hendrickson |first=Josh |date=November 30, 2023 |title=Apple's Latest iOS Beta Finally Lets You Change the Default Notification Sound |url=https://www.pcmag.com/news/apples-latest-ios-beta-finally-lets-you-change-the-default-notification |access-date=December 2, 2023 |website=PC Magazine |language=en |archive-date=December 1, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231201101552/https://www.pcmag.com/news/apples-latest-ios-beta-finally-lets-you-change-the-default-notification |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Charging ===
* iPhone 15 models now support [[Qi (standard)|Qi2]] wireless charging. This was later added to the [[iPhone 13]] and [[iPhone 14]] models in the iOS 17.2 update.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Jay |date=December 5, 2023 |title=iPhone 13 and iPhone 14 will get Qi2 support with iOS 17.2 |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/12/5/23989606/iphone-13-14-qi2-magsafe-compatible-apple-ios-17-2 |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=The Verge |language=en |archive-date=December 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231206152334/https://www.theverge.com/2023/12/5/23989606/iphone-13-14-qi2-magsafe-compatible-apple-ios-17-2 |url-status=live }}</ref>

== App features ==

=== Phone ===

== European Union-specific changes ==
In compliance with the [[Digital Markets Act]], Apple introduced a set of additional features only for those living in [[European Union]] countries. These features were rolled out beginning with iOS 17.4.<ref>{{cite web | last=Weatherbed | first=Jess | title=iOS 17.4 is here and ready for a whole new Europe | website=The Verge | date=March 5, 2024 | url=https://www.theverge.com/2024/3/5/24090161/ios-17-4-update-released-dma-eu-third-party-app-store-nfc-payments | access-date=March 6, 2024 | archive-date=March 6, 2024 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240306034235/https://www.theverge.com/2024/3/5/24090161/ios-17-4-update-released-dma-eu-third-party-app-store-nfc-payments | url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | last=Clover | first=Juli | title=Apple Releases iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4 With EU App Changes, New Emoji, Podcast Transcripts and More | website=MacRumors | date=March 5, 2024 | url=https://www.macrumors.com/2024/03/05/apple-releases-ios-17-4/ | access-date=March 6, 2024 | archive-date=March 5, 2024 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305212320/https://www.macrumors.com/2024/03/05/apple-releases-ios-17-4/ | url-status=live }}</ref>

These include:
* The installation of 3rd party alternatives to the App Store.
* The ability to download web browsers that use web engines other than [[WebKit]].
* Management of default web browser settings.
* The ability for a user to choose alternative payment methods to use in the app store.

Additionally, Apple has put in place measures to prevent all users outside of the EU from accessing any of those features. 

These measures include: 
* Requiring a user's Apple ID region to be set to one of the EU’s 27 member states. 
* Performing routine on-device geolocation checks to ensure a user is physically present within the EU’s borders.
* Making it so that users who travel out of the EU can continue accessing 3rd party app stores for a grace period of 30 days. Users who are away from the EU for more than 30 days will lose access to these features; they can continue using previously installed apps but are unable to update or install apps from 3rd party app stores.<ref>{{citation|url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/118110|title=About alternative app marketplaces in the European Union - Apple Support|access-date=March 6, 2024|archive-date=March 7, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240307031226/https://support.apple.com/en-us/118110|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{citation|url=https://superchargednews.com/2024/03/05/ios-17-4-dma-geolocation-restricts/|title=Apple details how it's preventing non-EU users from accessing iOS 17.4's expanded app ecosystem - Supercharged|date=March 5, 2024 |access-date=March 6, 2024|archive-date=March 5, 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305201946/https://superchargednews.com/2024/03/05/ios-17-4-dma-geolocation-restricts/|url-status=live}}</ref>

== Reception ==
Reception for iOS 17 upon its release date was generally positive.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cipriani |first=Jason |date=September 25, 2023 |title=iOS 17 is full of surprise and delight |url=https://www.cnn.com/cnn-underscored/reviews/ios-17 |access-date=December 12, 2023 |website=CNN Underscored |language=en |archive-date=October 26, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231026154402/https://www.cnn.com/cnn-underscored/reviews/ios-17 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":6">{{Cite web |title=Apple iOS 17 Review |url=https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/apple-ios-17 |access-date=December 12, 2023 |website=PC Magazine |language=en |archive-date=December 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231212012341/https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/apple-ios-17 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":7">{{Cite web |title=iOS 17 Review: StandBy Mode, Meaningful Changes in Messages and More |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-review-standby-mode-meaningful-changes-in-messages-and-more/ |access-date=December 12, 2023 |publisher=CNET |language=en |archive-date=December 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231212012341/https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-17-review-standby-mode-meaningful-changes-in-messages-and-more/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Critics praised the new Contact Posters, Check In, and StandBy mode. They also liked the improvements to stickers, widgets, text prediction, the Camera app, Shortcuts, verification codes, and the Reminders app.<ref name=":7" /> However, many media outlets criticized the lack of the [[Journal (Apple)|Journal]] app that was announced during the iOS 17 segment.<ref name=":6" /><ref name=":7" /> The Journal app was later released, first as part of the iOS 17.2 beta to developers and public beta testers, then to the general public as part of the iOS 17.2 stable release.
